Coach Hambleton has issued his
first call for trackmen. All those
who have any ability on the cinder
path or in field events are urged
to report at the gym on afternoons
at 4 o'clock. The team has lost a
number of men through graduation, and many varsity berths are
open. Coach Hambleton and Capt.
Graziano are on the lookout for
new material, and those interested
should report to them.

Up Fine Record Since
Last Meeting
Fresh from their recent triumph
over the Haverford College five, the
Big Blue quintet will travel to the
Nation's Capitol to engage the American University team tomorrow night.
Eagles Show Improvement
In the last skirmish between these
two teams the Blue Jays left the floor
after giving the hoopsters from American University a decisive 58-30 lacing. However, during the time that
has elapsed since that meeting the
Washington boys have compiled an
envious record. Their latest major accomplishment was a 37-32 win over

With Reuben Pi Lambda Leads
Division A Of Frat
Volleyball Tourney

Last year's trophy winner, Pi
Lambda Phi, is again leading Division
A. of the interfrat volleyball league.
The Pi Lams have won all of their six
games, and Tau Alpha Omega and
D. U. are fighting it out for second
place with four wins and one loss
each. Delta Upsilon went down before
T. A. 0. last week, and have yet to
face Pi Lam.
An Interfraternity Athletic meeting was held last week at which the
standing of volleyball was discussed.
It was decided to discontinue volleyball next year as an interfrat sport
unless more interest is shown in the
next three weeks.

LACROSSE
An organization meeting of all
those interested in lacrosse will be
held at the Gymnasium at 4 o'clock
today. All members of last season's
stick squad and any aspirants are
requested to report at this initial
roll call. Plans for the coming year
season and other relatively important
matters will be discussed.
Manager Herman Sody requests
that all Freshmen aspiring to managerial berths should report to him
today, since an urgent need for managers now confronts the squad.

TRACK

I

Coach Hambleton has issued his
first call for trackmen. All those
who have any ability on the cinder
path or in field events are urged
to report at the gym on afternoons
at 4 o'clock. The team has lost a
number of men through graduation, and many varsity berths are
open. Coach Hambleton and Capt.
Graziano are on the lookout for
new material, and those interested
should report to them.

American Quintet Has Built
Up Fine Record Since
Last Meeting
Fresh from their recent triumph
over the Haverford College five, the
Big Blue quintet will travel to the
Nation's Capitol to engage the American University team tomorrow night.
Eagles Show Improvement
In the last skirmish between these
two teams the Blue Jays left the floor
after giving the hoopsters from American University a decisive 58-30 lacing. However, during the time that
has elapsed since that meeting the
Washington boys have compiled an
envious record. Their latest major accomplishment was a 37-32 win over

Last year's trophy winner, Pi
Lambda Phi, is again leading Division
A. of the interfrat volleyball league.
The Pi Lams have won all of their six
games, and Tau Alpha Omega and
D. U. are fighting it out for second
place with four wins and one loss
each. Delta Upsilon went down before
T. A. 0. last week, and have yet to
face Pi Lam.
An Interfraternity Athletic meeting was held last week at which the
standing of volleyball was discussed.
It was decided to discontinue volleyball next year as an interfrat sport
unless more interest is shown in the
next three weeks.

LACROSSE
An organization meeting of all
those interested in lacrosse will be
held at the Gymnasium at 4 o'clock
today. All members of last season's
stick squad and any aspirants are
requested to report at this initial
roll call. Plans for the coming year
season and other relatively important
matters will be discussed.
Manager Herman Sody requests
that all Freshmen aspiring to managerial berths should report to him
today, since an urgent need for managers now confronts the squad.
